definitions.definition: Referring back to the subject , or having an object equal to the subject.
Of a relation R on a set S , such that xRx for all members x of S (that is, the relation holds between any element of the set and itself).
examples: "Equals" is a reflexive relation, as it holds for all possible x; "not less" is non-reflexive because it is true only for some x and y, "unequal" is irreflexive , as it never holds between x and itself.

definitions.definition: Of or resulting from a reflex .
examples: The electric shock elicited an automatic and reflexive response from him.

definitions.definition: Producing or provoking a reciprocal response.

main_definition: ( grammar ) Referring back to the subject , or having an object equal to the subject.
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) Of a relation R on a set S , such that xRx for all members x of S (that is, the relation holds between any element of the set and itself).
Of or resulting from a reflex .
( politics ) Producing or provoking a reciprocal response.
